definition: number of people in a family/population/(old) adult males/male servants
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)

sentences.english: Likewise, a human marriage influenced by wealth often results in offspring.
sentences.chinese: 同样地，财力雄厚的人类婚姻往往也能使得人丁兴旺。

sentences.english: People-oriented tax institution between Jin Dynasty and Tang Dynasty is very famous.
sentences.chinese: 晋唐人丁为本税制是我国著名的农业税制。

sentences.english: As a matter of fact, I have a brother with a large and thriving family of sons.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，我有个弟弟，他家大口多，人丁兴旺。

sentences.english: If the land is protected, and the resources are there, these people will thrive.
sentences.chinese: 如果土地和资源得到保护，人丁便兴旺起来。

sentences.english: This means that you have more financial means to provide for your growing family.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着你有更多的财力来为你的家族人丁兴旺。

sentences.english: He makes promises of progeny to Abraham and his heirs.
sentences.chinese: 他答应亚伯拉罕及他的后代人丁兴旺。

sentences.english: Would an economic downturn quickly send head-counts plunging again?
sentences.chinese: 一次经济低迷会不会很快让人丁兴旺之景再度幻灭？

sentences.english: Several factors contributed to the belief in the stork as the bringer of babies.
sentences.chinese: 有几个因素导致了人们相信鹳能让家庭增添人丁。

sentences.english: When ye were but few， even a few， and strangers in it.
sentences.chinese: 当时你们人丁有限，数目稀少，并且在那地为寄居的。

definition: (of status or wealth) to decline/(of buildings etc) to become dilapidated/run-down/(of plants) to wilt
collateral relative (descended from a common ancestor but through different lines)
relatives/members of the same family, clan, tribe etc
